bundles.name: Offset Loan
bundles.additionalInfo: Offset loans include an annual fee waiver for the Platinum Rewards Credit Card and everyday banking.

features.additionalInfo: You can self-serve your day-to-day banking needs via Bank Australia's App or Internet Banking.

A Mortgage Offset account reduces the amount of interest you pay on your home loan. The amount within this account is offset against your home loan, meaning you only pay interest on the difference. Up to a limit of $20,000.
Construction Loan Offset - We protect an equivalent amount of land on the Bank Australia Conservation Reserve as is being constructed to help offset the environmental impact of land clearing
Make your loan repayments weekly, fortnightly or monthly

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals (natural persons) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Not available for non-personal borrowers.
Applications for loans are subject to the Bank's lending criteria.
Australian citizen or permanent resident of Australia

fees.name: Annual Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Annual fee payable on all Offset loans. The fee is debited to the loan annually on the anniversary date of funding and is non refundable. Only one annual fee applies per customer where multiple Offset loans exist.

fees.name: Mortgage Discharge Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when you discharge the mortgage. Statutory government registration fees will still apply

fees.name: Portability Fee- Existing Mortgage
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when a property securing a loan is replaced with a property that is already registered with a Bank Australia mortgage.

fees.name: Portability Fee- New Mortgage
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when you request that a property securing a loan is replaced with a property that is a new security to Bank Australia.

fees.name: Valuation Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: If you request a loan variation, Bank Australia may need to revalue your property before approving the request.

fees.name: Loan Variation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when transferring from a home loan product to a different home loan product. For example, transferring a variable rate product to a fixed rate product.

fees.name: Additional Valuation
fees.additionalInfo: The establishment fee covers a standard loan, which includes one valuation. This fee applies for any additional standard residential valuation required.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: T&C's apply - see website for more detail

fees.name: Additional Valuation

fees.name: Break Fee

The fee is calculated at the time of the event and is specifically related to your individual loan. More information is found in the loan fees and charges document.

fees.name: Home Loan Establishment Fee - Existing Mortgage
fees.additionalInfo: Payable for all requests to increase a current loan or for an additional loan where Bank Australia already holds a registered mortgage.

fees.name: Home Loan Establishment Fee - New mortgage
fees.additionalInfo: Payable for all mortgage secured loans to cover Bank Australia administration costs including preparing security documents.

fees.name: Loan Variation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when transferring from a home loan product to a different home loan product. For example, transferring a variable rate product to a fixed rate product.

fees.name: Mortgage Discharge Fee

fees.name: Portability Fee- New Mortgage
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when you request that a property securing a loan is replaced with a property that is a new security to Bank Australia.

fees.name: Valuation Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: If you request a loan variation, Bank Australia may need to revalue your property before approving the request.

fees.name: Rate Lock
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when you choose to lock in the fixed rate at application. 0.10% of the total fixed loan amount for approved home loan applications (minimum fee $50). This applies to 1, 2, 3 and 5 year Fixed Rate home loans only and is a non-refundable fee.

bundles.name: Clean Energy loan
bundles.additionalInfo: Clean Energy Home loans include an annual fee waiver for the Platinum Rewards Credit Card and everyday banking.

features.additionalInfo: You can self-serve your day-to-day banking needs via Bank Australia's App or Internet Banking.
A Mortgage Offset account reduces the amount of interest you pay on your home loan. The amount within this account is offset against your home loan, meaning you only pay interest on the difference.

Eco-Pause: Our Eco-Pause lets customers take a break from their mortgage repayments and redirect their money to eco upgrades such as solar panels, batteries and water tanks. With an eco-pause you can pause your repayments for three months or halve them for six. Conditions apply.
Flexible Repayments: Make your loan repayments weekly, fortnightly or monthly

Parental Pause: Welcoming a new family member to the family can place a pretty big strain on finances so we offer you the option of pausing your home loan repayments to give you some breathing space.This allows you to take a break from payments for three months or halve them for six. Conditions apply.
Construction Loan Offset: We protect an equivalent amount of land on the Bank Australia Conservation Reserve as is being constructed to help offset the environmental impact of land clearing
If you're ahead of your repayments, you may be able to redraw fee free, with restrictions if your loan is fixed

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals (natural persons) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Individuals only: Not available for non-personal borrowers.
Eligibility for the Clean Energy loan reduced rate is subject to the Bank's Eligibility Criteria found in the Key Information. Conditions apply.
Applications for loans are subject to the Bank's lending criteria.

fees.name: Domestic ("press credit") cash withdrawal fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee that applies to any cash withdrawal transaction within Australia made using the "credit" option on a Bank Australia Visa Debit card.

fees.name: International transaction fee
fees.additionalInfo: When you undertake an International transaction on a Bank Australia Visa Debit Card you will be charged the fee. An International transaction is any purchase, withdrawal or credit in a currency other than Australian Dollars or where the merchant or financial institution accepting the transaction is outside of Australia or where there is a currency conversion.

fees.name: Visa foreign cash withdrawal fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee that applies to any cash withdrawal transaction made with your Bank Australia Visa Debit Card outside Australia.

fees.name: Exceeding available funds fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you exceed the actual balance or authorised limit of your savings account, transaction account, or overdraft facility greater than $100 payable on the day the event occurs or next day.

fees.name: Monthly account fee
fees.additionalInfo: A flat fee payable on the last day of each month.

fees.name: Debit interest charge rate
fees.additionalInfo: Additional interest charged on overdrawn account.

fees.name: Staff assisted withdrawal fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for taking money out of your account with the assistance of a staff member, charged on the day the service is provided.

fees.name: Certificates supplied by the bank
fees.additionalInfo: A fee for comprehensive certficates supplied for audit. The cost is $60 per hour with a minimum $30 per certificate.

fees.name: Duplicate statement fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee that may be charged if you order a copy of a statement that has already been issued on your account. This fee per statement and is charged on or after the day you order the duplicate statement.

fees.name: Dormancy
fees.additionalInfo: Administration fee where account has been transferred to dormancy status. The cost per quarter charged on the last day of March, June, September and December.

fees.name: Security token fee
fees.additionalInfo: When you request that we provide you with a physical Token to provide an additional layer of security when you engage in transactions that carry a higher risk. We do not charge for the virtual token.

fees.name: Same day funds transfers within Australia fee (RTGS)
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is for a Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS) payment which refers to the process of transferring money from one bank to another in Australia on a real time and gross basis. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Staff assisted international payment in foreign currency
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged when you make an International Payment in foreign currency via a Branch or the Contact Centre. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Staff assisted international payment in AUD
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged when you make an International Payment in AUD via a Branch or the Contact Centre. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Online international payment in foreign currency
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged when you make an International Payment in foreign currency on-line via Internet banking or Bank Australia app. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Inwards Payment fee
fees.additionalInfo: International money transfer from overseas (other fees may be charged by participating banks involved in the transaction or settlement). The cost is per transaction.

Early Withdrawal: If you want to withdraw your TD prior to maturity, you are required to provide 31 days' prior notice. You may incur an interest adjustment and a Term Deposit early withdrawal admin fee.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Sole traders, Pty Ltd, public companies, partnerships or associations

Children aged 12 years and younger requires that a parent or guardian is a signatory to the account until the child turns 13 years old. At the age of 13 years old, the parent or guardian may at the child's election, cease to be a signatory.
Natural Person or In trust for a Natural Person or Non-Individual entity
Be an Australian citizen, permanent resident or have a valid visa; or entity be registered in Australia

fees.name: Term Deposit early withdrawal
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for withdrawal of funds from your term deposit prior to its maturity.

fees.name: Company/business name searches
fees.additionalInfo: When we conduct a search of the ASIC register to obtain information about the ownership of a company in adminstration of an account. The cost is per search.

fees.name: Certificates supplied by the bank
fees.additionalInfo: A fee for comprehensive certficates supplied for audit. The cost is $60 per hour with a minimum $30 per certificate.

fees.name: Duplicate statement fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee that may be charged if you order a copy of a statement that has already been issued on your account. This fee per statement and is charged on or after the day you order the duplicate statement.

fees.name: Dormancy
fees.additionalInfo: Administration fee where account has been transferred to dormancy status. The cost per quarter charged on the last day of March, June, September and December.

fees.name: Security token fee
fees.additionalInfo: When you request that we provide you with a physical Token to provide an additional layer of security when you engage in transactions that carry a higher risk. We do not charge for the virtual token.

fees.name: SMS alert fee
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged when you elect to receive notifications about your account via SMS messages to a mobile telephone number you have given us for contacting you. The cost is per sms.

fees.name: Same day funds transfers within Australia fee (RTGS)
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is for a Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS) payment which refers to the process of transferring money from one bank to another in Australia on a real time and gross basis. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Staff assisted international payment in foreign currency
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged when you make an International Payment in foreign currency via a Branch or the Contact Centre. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Staff assisted international payment in AUD
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged when you make an International Payment in AUD via a Branch or the Contact Centre. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Online international payment in foreign currency
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged when you make an International Payment in foreign currency on-line via Internet banking or Bank Australia app. The cost is per transfer.

fees.name: Inwards Payment fee
fees.additionalInfo: International money transfer from overseas (other fees may be charged by participating banks involved in the transaction or settlement). The cost is per transaction.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Interest rates expressed as annual percentage rates. The interest rates shown are for an amount of $500 to $3,000,000 for personal customers.  For commercial customers the interest rates shown are for an amount of $500 to $1,000,000.
